Hey Mike -

I'm curious to know why =
you didn't use REST features available in WCF 
since it seems your work is =
being done in .NET.

Additionally, can you provide an explanation on the fo=
llowing statement:

It should be noted that XML (text/xml) is not a very us=
eful "content 
type" for building HTTP applications. Other content types th=
at would be 
more useful would be Atom (application/atom+xml) or RDF 
(appl=
ication/rdf+xml). However, for this example, we'll use XML to keep 
things =
as simple as possible. If you wish, you can use this example as 
a starting=
 point to add support for your favorite content type.
